subject: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Implementation of Risk & Cost Measures - reg.
text: HRa 75y TTHrgferazrut (Tsw5 4Rdev er RTHrf HARTY, IRT FRGR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Fruia JIa 0-5 & 6, 7arr-10, aRqT, T feqlt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 TMT9/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Consultancy /2024 Policy Circular No.10.2,37/2024 dated 08th July, 2024 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. RAJDIV-19-3/2024-Rajasthan Division (Comp. No. 251358)} Sub: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Implementation of Risk & Cost Measures reg: 1 _ Introduction: The Contractor/ Concessionaire is required to construct and maintain the Project Highway within the timelines given and as per the Specifications and Standards prescribed under the Contract Agreement/Concession Agreement (the "CA")- In the past, it has been experienced that awarding of balance maintenance work to a third party at the Risk and Cost of the Contractor/ Concessionaire becomes necessary on account of the Contractor's/ Concessionaire' s failure to maintain the Project, in terms of the Contract. In such cases, timely actions by the Authority Engineers  Independent Engineers (the IE") and the Authority in identifying the defects/delays and then awarding and getting the balance maintenance work executed through the third party ("Third Party Agency") becomes extremely important so that the Project can be maintained at the earliest for public use _ Thus, with the vision to lay down a systematic procedure of getting the risk and cost works done, this policy circular is being issued indicating a comprehensive set of directions entailing the process for identifying the risk and cost trigger events, procedure of getting the works done at the risk and cost of the Contractor/ Concessionaire by a third party, recovery of money etc. 2 Objective of Policy: The primary aim of this Policy Circular is to implement a systematic and informed approach for the works to be taken up by the Authority at Risk and Cost of the Contractor / Concessionaire. The specific objectives of the Policy Circular are: To establish a Risk and Cost framework for the Authority: To enable   timely identification and replacement of   non-performing and/or defaulting Contractor/ Concessionaire. To maintain transparency and rationality in execution of Risk and Cost. To help the decision makers of the Organization explicitly take account of uncertainty; determine the cause of such uncertainty and work towards the solution to address it: To minimize litigations arising out of ambiguities in the Risk and Cost procedure_ 3 Applicability: This SOP shall be applicable to the projects under EPC, HAM, BOT, TOT; Item Rate and PBMC.
